p.style: margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Letter not found. Item is a register entry only, of a letter dated 19 January 1877. I’m not sure why this letter is missing as others in the series have been found. It might be worth checking the file again at PRO.

p.seg: [Asks that engravings of gum trees Wattles &c be prepared his work on popular plants for schools]

p.style: margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: This letter was returned to M on 25 January 1877, minuted by MacPherson: ‘I dont know such a work is going on’. M responded to MacPherson’s minute on 29 January and was given approval for his original request on 1 February. M responded again on 7 February and was told the same day: ‘MS can be sent to Printer’. See also M to J. MacPherson, 14 April 1877.
